title: Chinese Bond Market Records Fourth Month of Foreign Outflows
sub_head: International investorsâ€™ holdings of yuan-denominated bonds have fallen by $61 billion since February
body:
Foreign investors cut their holdings of Chinese bonds by another $16 billion in May, a month that saw the yuan hit its lowest level in 20 months, as institutions continued to shift money into other assets that offer better returns.
May marked a fourth straight month of outflows from Chinese yuan-denominated bonds, and took the total drawdown since February to about $61 billion.
